clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome Study of Restrictive vs. Liberal Intraoperative Fluid Management Guided by PPV in Esophagectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Postoperative Lung Function, Kidney Function, Inflammatory Response and Short-term Outcome After Esophagectomy and Reconstruction: Intraoperative Fluid Management Controlled With Lower and Higher Pulse Pressure Variation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether intraoperative restrictive fluid management guided by pulse pressure variation produces a better effect on the postoperative lung function, kidney function, inflammatory response and short-term outcome after esophagectomy and reconstruction.

detailed_description.textblock: Measurements: intraoperative Lung injury score, Lung water index, Pulmonary vascular Permeability Index Measurements: intraoperative and postoperative Plasma creatine, C reactive protein (CRP), lactate, Neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin (NGAL), Interleukin-6 (IL-6), Interleukin-8 (IL-8)

clinical_study.why_stopped: The grant for this study was not allowed.

primary_outcome.measure: postoperative lung function, kidney function, inflammatory response
primary_outcome.description: plasma creatinine, CRP, lactate, NGAL, IL-6, IL-8

secondary_outcome.time_frame: the duration of hospital stay, about 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory complication, cardiovascular complication, acute renal failure, another complications

arm_group.description: To Keep intraoperative pulse pressure variation above 18%.
To keep intraoperative pulse pressure variation below 13%.

intervention.description: Intraoperative fluid therapy is directed by pulse pressure variation to a setting value, above 18% or below 13%.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients undergoing esophagectomy and reconstruction
Exclusion Criteria:
- ASA score >= 3, (American Society of Anesthesiologist physical status classification system)
- arrythmia, atrial fibrillation
- lung diseases, such as COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease); lung function test showed moderate to severe ventilation defect
- plasma creatinine level above 1.5 mg/dl

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology, National Taiwan University Hospital
